result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary F. Konkol was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine, costs, and DNA surcharge within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Gary F. Konkol in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:11 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address of Defendant is confirmed.

Defendant is pleading to Count 1.
State recommends $250 fine plus costs and surcharges.

Atty Renc concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Resisting/Obstructing an Officer

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing, fair and appropriate disposition.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Pay a fine of $250 plus costs
Pay DNA surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan and comply with the plan
Provide DNA sample

Defendant Gary F. Konkol appeared by video. Attorney Anne Renc in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold of any kind. 
No contact with Buffalo Wild Wings.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Resisting/Obstructing an Officer.

State requests a $250 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.
